test-case.name: merge-001
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on a homogeneous collection of XML log files.

result.assert-xml: <events><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:01Z">Transaction T1234 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:05Z">Transaction T1236 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:08Z">Transaction T1235 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:09Z">Transaction T1236 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:11Z">Transaction T1237 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:12Z">Transaction T1235 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:15Z">Transaction T1234 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:17Z">Transaction T1237 ended</event></events>

test-case.name: merge-002
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on two heterogeneous files.

test-case.name: merge-003
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on two heterogeneous files. Testing merge-key, where order attribute requires run-time evaluation

test-case.name: merge-004
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on two heterogeneous files- output using the current-grouping-key

test-case.name: merge-005
test-case.description: xsl:merge: xsl:merge-source that uses a path expression that selects more than one node in an attribute value template (test with context)

result.assert-xml: <results><result><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:01Z">Transaction T1234 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:08Z">Transaction T1235 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:12Z">Transaction T1235 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:15Z">Transaction T1234 ended</event ></result><result><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:15Z">Transaction T1234 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:12Z">Transaction T1235 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:08Z">Transaction T1235 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:01Z">Transaction T1234 started</event ></result></results>

test-case.name: merge-006
test-case.description: xsl:merge: xsl:merge-source that uses a path expression that selects more than one node in an attribute value template

test-case.name: merge-007
test-case.description: xsl:merge test with more than one xsl:merge-action child elements

test-case.name: merge-008
test-case.description: Test xsl:merge-key with different languages.

test-case.name: merge-009
test-case.description: Different count of xsl:merge-key grandchildren of a xsl:merge-source to another xsl:merge-source.

test-case.name: merge-010
test-case.description: Test xsl:merge-key with the disallowed stable attribute.

modified.change: XTSE0090 (not allowed attribute for XSLT instruction) instead of XTSE0010

test-case.name: merge-011
test-case.description: Testing disallowed merge-key, where data-type attribute requires run-time evaluation

test-case.name: merge-012
test-case.description: xsl:merge test with multiple merge keys

test-case.name: merge-013
test-case.description: xsl:merge test - selects two anchor items in the same document

test-case.name: merge-014
test-case.description: xsl:merge test - selects two anchor items from two document

test-case.name: merge-015
test-case.description: xsl:merge test - selects three anchor items from two document

test-case.name: merge-016
test-case.description: xsl:merge test of merge-input with empty sequence at run-time

test-case.name: merge-017
test-case.description: The @select attribute of xsl:merge-key should be a singleton, but evaluated to be a sequence of items

test-case.name: merge-018
test-case.description: Test xsl:merge - perform sort with a xsl:merge-input

test-case.name: merge-019
test-case.description: Sequence of merge-input is text, but the data-type attribute of xsl:merge-key is number

test-case.name: merge-020
test-case.description: Test xsl:merge-key with different languages.

modified.change: XTDE2210 instead of XTSE2210, corrected invalid sequence type to function(*).

test-case.name: merge-021
test-case.description: Test xsl:merge-input with incorrect order.

test-case.name: merge-022
test-case.description: Test xsl:merge-key context: visibility of variable defined in xsl:merge-input

test-case.name: merge-023
test-case.description: xsl:merge-keys in corresponding merge-inputs not comparable

test-case.name: merge-024
test-case.description: xsl:merge test of intersection

test-case.name: merge-025
test-case.description: xsl:merge test of union

test-case.name: merge-026
test-case.description: xsl:merge-source test with no xsl:merge-key child elements

test-case.name: merge-027
test-case.description: xsl:merge-input test with select attribute and sequence constructor content

test-case.name: merge-028
test-case.description: xsl:merge: xsl:merge-source that uses a path expression that selects more than one node in an attribute value template

test-case.name: merge-029
test-case.description: xsl:merge: live use case, see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10271639/xslt-merge-challenge

result.assert-xml: <Customer><CustId>1</CustId><CustName>Acme</CustName ><Addresses><Address status="NoChange"><AddressesId>1</AddressesId><Street>123 Main</Street></Address ><Address status="Updated"><AddressesId>2</AddressesId><Street>999 Updated St.</Street></Address ><Address status="New"><AddressesId>3</AddressesId><Street>3999 New St.</Street></Address ><Address status="Deleted"><AddressesId>4</AddressesId><Street>888 Goner St.</Street></Address></Addresses></Customer>

test-case.name: merge-030
test-case.description: xsl:merge test with zero xsl:merge-source child elements

test-case.name: merge-031
test-case.description: xsl:merge-source test with zero xsl:merge-input child elements

test-case.name: merge-032
test-case.description: xsl:merge-key test with select attribute has non-empty content

test-case.name: merge-033
test-case.description: xsl:merge-source is in the wrong place

test-case.name: merge-034
test-case.description: xsl:merge-source with more than one xsl:merge-input child element - error

test-case.name: merge-035
test-case.description: xsl:merge with a disallowed child element

test-case.name: merge-036
test-case.description: xsl:merge-source with a disallowed child element

test-case.name: merge-037
test-case.description: xsl:merge-input with xsl:merge-key not at as last child node

test-case.name: merge-038
test-case.description: Testing a sequence of more than one item is not allowed as the @select attr of merge-key

test-case.name: merge-039
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on a homogeneous collection of XML log files, using for-each-stream

result.assert-xml: <events><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:01Z">Transaction T1234 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:05Z">Transaction T1236 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:08Z">Transaction T1235 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:09Z">Transaction T1236 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:11Z">Transaction T1237 started</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:12Z">Transaction T1235 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:15Z">Transaction T1234 ended</event ><event timestamp="2009-08-20T12:01:17Z">Transaction T1237 ended</event></events>

test-case.name: merge-040
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on two heterogeneous files, using for-each-stream

test-case.name: merge-041
test-case.description: xsl:merge test on two heterogeneous files. Testing merge-key, where order attribute requires run-time evaluation. Mixing different ways of selecting different sources. Also tests use of xml:base affecting URI resolution.

test-case.name: merge-042
test-case.description: Error - can't specify both for-each-item and for-each-stream

test-case.name: merge-043
test-case.description: Error - for-each-stream expected type is string

test-case.name: merge-044
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-group with source name argument

test-case.name: merge-045
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-group with source name argument; unknown source name

test-case.name: merge-046
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-group with source name argument; invalid source name

test-case.name: merge-047
test-case.description: xsl:merge: dynamic argument to current-merge-group()

test-case.name: merge-048
test-case.description: xsl:merge: dynamic argument to current-merge-group(); unknown source name

test-case.name: merge-049
test-case.description: xsl:merge: merge two documents with validation=strict

test-case.name: merge-050
test-case.description: xsl:merge: merge two documents with validation failure

test-case.name: merge-051
test-case.description: xsl:merge: merge two documents with validation by type

test-case.description: xsl:merge: merge two documents with validation by type, failure

test-case.name: merge-053
test-case.description: xsl:merge: merge two documents with validation; both validation and type specified, error.

test-case.name: merge-054
test-case.description: xsl:merge: merge two documents with validation; validation specified without for-each-stream, error.

test-case.name: merge-055
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-group() not available in called template.

test-case.name: merge-056
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-key() not available in called template.

test-case.name: merge-057
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-group() used within a pattern.

test-case.name: merge-058
test-case.description: xsl:merge: current-merge-key() used within a pattern.
